summary:
Bianca Carague is a Netherlands-based Filipino artist and designer. She creates captivating virtual landscapes and environments that allude to alternate worlds and possible futures. She uniquely blends design research with fiction and worldbuilding to create thought-provoking narratives that explore social issues and emerging technologies.

Her unique perspective on worldbuilding and pioneering work in game world therapy have gained her recognition across prestigious platforms around the world such as Vogue, Elle Decor, and FRAME Magazine.

Bianca's recent solo exhibition, 'Gen C: Children of 2050,' demonstrated her ability to spark critical and creative thinking about the future through immersive installations and accompanying workshops, which allowed thousands of participants to build off of her work about the climate crisis. Her game-changing project, Bump Galaxy, where she created a Minecraft server for mental healthcare, showcased her ingenuity, as she provided virtual landscapes and gaming experiences for care during the challenging times of the COVID-19 pandemic. During that time, she grew it to 3,000,000+ sqm of digital biomes for various forms of therapy and proved that playing together could mean caring for each other.

She has exhibited in Dutch Design Week, London Design Biennale, Triennale di Milano, Het Nieuwe Instituut and Tetem. She has even collaborated with Vogue Philippines on a 16-page spread and cover story on Philippine identity in the metaverse.

Through her workshops across Europe and Asia, she also shares her expertise with young people to learn about Futures Literacy through art. Collaborating with esteemed institutions such as Tetem, Iceland University of the Arts, Hogeschool voor de Kunsten Utrecht (HKU) and University of San Marino, Bianca has made a significant impact in fostering creativity and futures thinking.

Bianca Carague's body of work serves as a testament to her dedication to provoke thought about the world we live in and the world we aspire to create.

https://bianca-carague.com/

school.name: De La Salle-College of Saint Benilde

awards.title: First Prize - Cisco Meet & Work in VR Competition
awards.description: Designed a virtual reality experience for multi-dimensional communication among stakeholders in construction projects for a competition by Domus Academy Milan in partnership with Cisco.

awards.title: Magna Cum Laude
awards.description: Graduated with the highest cumulative GPA in the entire graduating batch of 900 students.
awards.issuer: De La Salle-College of Saint Benilde

awards.title: Semi-Finalist - Benilde Prize: Innovation for Inclusion
awards.description: Semi-finalist for a national university-based social design and innovation competition for designing an inclusive business model that aimed to help sugarcane farmers and significantly reduce waste through the production of bioplastic products.

awards.title: Dean's Honor List, Top 10 (#1)
awards.description: Received a plaque of recognition for being the top student out of 14,000 in the college with a GPA of 3.91 for SY 2013-2014.
awards.issuer: De La Salle - College of Saint Benilde

awards.title: School of Design & Arts Grant
awards.description: Full scholarship from freshman to senior year.
awards.issuer: De La Salle - College of Saint Benilde

projects.title: Virtual Design Week: Reflections on A New Digital Earth
projects.description: Virtual Design Week: Reflections on a New Digital Earth is the first online design festival solely focusing on designs made in the digital space for the digital space. Through an online exhibition and discussions, designers are invited to reflect on virtual design through the lenses of sustainability, equality and community.

projects.title: Bump Galaxy
projects.description: Bump Galaxy is a virtual world and community for mental health. It deinstitutionalizes healthcare by bringing people together across national borders, care practices and knowledge worlds, blurring the lines between a consumer and producer of knowledge; a giver and receiver of care.

projects.title: You Will Not Be
projects.description: Exhibited in Triennale di Milano (Milan, Italy) & Het Nieuwe Instituut (Rotterdam, Netherlands). You Will Not Be is an exhibition and performance that dares to question the true meaning of efficiency (and 24/7 economy) in the world today.

projects.title: BentaMobile
projects.description: BentaMobile was a social design endeavor which aimed to respond to the pains and aspirations of informal street vendors by helping them become recognized members of the community, formalizing their businesses by conducting field research and routine immersions within local communities in the city of Manila and involving community stakeholders in the design of innovative solutions to social problems.

projects.title: Oasis
projects.description: Major cities across the world are in danger of losing water in the next few decades, unless their water use radically changes. Oasis rekindles our relationship with our most valuable resource by making us imagine a world without it.

projects.title: Voluminous Territories
projects.description: Soon to be exhibited in “Designers at the Borders” augmented reality exhibition. Using Cyprus’ political and economic climate as a case study, Voluminous Territories demonstrates  through data visualisation in the form of physical models and an archive how private companies are reshaping our world and transforming our notions of territory.

projects.title: Manolo Living x Aeta Collaboration
projects.description: Livelihood project wherein we collaborated with an indigenous Aeta community in the Philippines to design and produce woven home accessories.

profile_positions.description:
•  Concept design to production of hybrid physical and digital exhibitions that reflect on social issues and emerging technologies.
•  Design and facilitation of workshops about worldbuilding and futures literacy for young people across Europe and Asia.
•  Design and facilitation of workshops for mental healthcare professionals who seek creative applications of their practice.
•  Developed the concept of ‘game world therapy’. Worked directly with different mental healthcare professionals to produce online care programs that use gaming environments & mechanics to facilitate various forms of therapy.
•  Design and production of virtual environments, games and social experiences for online platforms such as Minecraft, The Sandbox and Somnium Space.
•  Collaborated with local government in The Philippines to design for inclusive FinTech adoption within informal economies and marginalized communities.
profile_positions.title: Artist

profile_positions.description:
• Creative direction for digital fashion collaborations.
• Designed UX & UI for in-house 3D fashion design tool.
profile_positions.title: Creative Director

profile_positions.description:
•  Horizon scanning for design trends and researched on social impact of design.
•  Oversaw production of a virtual design event from concept and planning to curation and execution.
profile_positions.title: Trend Researcher - Design & Social Impact

profile_positions.description:
•  Designed user interface and information architecture of website. •  Grew social media presence on LinkedIn, Instagram and Facebook for a real estate company.
•  Managed online property listings and communicated sale/rental terms with real estate brokers & agents.
profile_positions.title: Associate Marketing Manager

profile_positions.description:
•  Coordinated between clients, suppliers, manufacturers and design team to effectively deliver furniture and interior projects.
•  Handled budgeting and product pricing for custom furniture.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
•  Decided on color and material combinations for seasonal releases of furniture pieces and home decor collections.
• Researched and presented proposals for use of new materials, finishes and production techniques in line with brand direction.
•  Designed and planned a collection of home decor through a livelihood project in co-creation with an indigenous community and independent artists.
profile_positions.title: Furniture Designer

profile_positions.description:
•  Transformed qualitative research into personas, user journeys, sitemaps, wireframes and a working prototype.
• Designed mobile food delivery app, from concept to wireframing,  information architecture, user interface & minimum viable product.
•  Piloted a multidisciplinary team of designers, businesspeople, marketers and app developers to develop a mobile app and social business ecosystem.
•  Conducted fieldwork, stakeholder workshops and user tests, gathered qualitative and quantitative data to develop insights on formalizing and digitizing businesses of illegal street vendors.
•  Engaged multiple stakeholders, specifically informal street vendors and their local government, throughout the design process.
profile_positions.title: Service Designer & Project Lead

profile_positions.description:
•  Designed furniture pieces and curated customized color, material and finish palettes for clients in line with brand direction.
•  Assisted with exhibition installations and production.
•  3D modeling and technical drawings.
profile_positions.title: Design Associate

profile_positions.description: Oversaw designs of home and fashion accessories from concept to production; visual merchandising for events.
